bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of an unusual disease with the whites of the eyes gradually turning black while vision remains unimpaired, the hair on the body and on the head stiffening, and even though patients can still eat and drink they are unable to speak. Ji feng pu ji fang 雞峰普濟方 26: 眼白人渾黑 , 見物依舊 , 毛髮直如鐵條 , 雖能飲食 , 不語如大醉 , 名曰 血潰 , “When the white parts of the eyes turn black, while one can still see things as normal, and the hair on the body and on the head rises straight as if it were iron sticks. Although [patients] are able to drink and eat, they cannot speak, as if they had drunken to intoxication. This is called ‘ blood festering ’”.
